DETAILS: delivered with the number of decimals as configured in GUI

if "Echo sensor" is configured, it's the meassured value in cm/sec.
if "Proximity switch" is configured it's 0.0 (sensor open) or 1.0 (sensor closed)

possible states are
OK - Sensor is OK, reading and protocol is valid
CRC_FAULT - protocol failure
DATA_MISSMATCH - protocol failure
NOT_CONNECTED - sensor is configured, but not connected to the 1wire bus.
NO_SENSOR_CONFIGURED - no sensor is configured for this item
one decimal or a "0" if no sensor is configured

Remaining time (in seconds) for possibly running HEATER-Postrun timer.

DESCRIPTION: Current state of the Cover (as plain text)
DETAILS:
States are:
OPEN - cover is open
CLOSED - cover is closed
OPENING - cover is moving to OPEN position
CLOSING -  cover is moving to CLOSED position
STOPPED - cover is stopped

VALUE NAME: STATES / RUNTIMES OF OUTPUTS ON RELAY-EXTENSION

DESCRIPTION: Current state of EXT1_1 output (1st Relay on relay-extension)
DETAILS:
0 - AUTO (not on)
1 - AUTO (on)
2 - AUTO (prio OFF by control rule)
3 - AUTO (prio ON by emergencyRule)
4 - MANUAL (ON)
5 - OFF by emergencyRule
6 - MANUAL (OFF)

DESCRIPTION: all outputs (EXT1_1 - EXT1_8) are hadled the same
Current state of EXT1_8 output (8th Relay on relay-extension)
Indicates a triggered dryrun (PUMP STOPPED) from Overflow vessel control
Indicates a triggered overfill (PUMP TURNED ON) from Overflow vessel control
Indicates a triggered refill from Overflow vessel control
Indicates if backwash should run, but can not be done (i.e. because of manual pump switching)
DETAILS:
NO - no delay
YES - backwash is delayed

DESCRIPTION: Starttime (timestamp) since when backwash is delayed
DETAILS: or 0 if no delay-timer is running

DESCRIPTION: Current step the whole backwash process is in
DETAILS: States are 0 - 6, not important for you

DESCRIPTION: indicates current state of a backwash process
DETAILS:
something like:
NEXT_BW_IN 2                                        - remianing days to next backwash
BW_DELAYED_SINCE 00h 01m 05s        - backwash is delayed since
BW_RUNNING                                         - backwash process started
BW_RUNNING_SINCE 123                      - includes the time in seconds, the backwash is currently running (PUMP ON)
BWR_RUNNING_SINCE 34                      - includes the time in seconds, the rinse is currently running (PUMP ON)
BW_DONE                                                - backwash is done

DESCRIPTION: Indicates if bathing-surveillance has detected a level change in the overflow vessel
DETAILS:
YES - surveillance is checking for the configured level-change / time in the vessel
NO - surveillance is resetted because water-level is not changing

DESCRIPTION: if surveillance is running, this is the start water-level to compare against
the current water-level in the overflow vessel
Indicates if bathing surveillance switched the pump on or not
Indicates at what time bathing surveillance switched the pump on
Indicates if the PV-Surplus function was triggered and how it was triggered
DETAILS:
States are
0 - PV-SURPLUS IS OFF (not riggered)
1 - PV-SURPLUS IS ON (triggered by Digital-Input switch)
2 - PV-SURPLUS IS ON (triggered by HTTP Request)
